page.title: 15Ecology - Migrating Birds
page.content: Birds which pass through the Isle of May fly to parts of the world. For example a Kittiwake ringed as a chick was recovered in Newfoundland the following year. A Robin has been recorded as taking only 6days to fly from the May to Holland, while a goldcrest flew from Finland in seventeen days. Ringing returns also yeild useful data about the age that birds attain in the wild, about details of their breeding sites and about their world distribution. It is this kind of information, accumulated over many years by amateur ornothologists and added to each season, which makes the Isle of May observatory such a valuable research site for the avifauna of Western Europe.
